p: Susceptibility of the biofilms of other microorganisms, such as Enterococcus faecalis [ 24], Escherichia coli, Staphylococcus aureus [ 38], and Pseudomonas aeruginosa [ 60], is also reported in the literature. Although very few, the studies that assessed the effect of C. zeylanicum EO on microbial biofilm had promising outcomes vis-Ã -vis its possible use in infectious diseases.
